title: We know that we are looking at a uniform distribution, and also that we are looking at a continuous probability function. What would this probability function look like? As it turns out, this function will look like a straight line from our start to end points. We can calculate the area under this function to get our desired probability.
If X goes from 0 to 20, how long is the interval of X?
$$P\left(0<x<2\right)$$ $$=$$ $$\frac{2}{20}$$. Starting to see a pattern? We can get the length in the interval we want, and divide that by the length of our total interval to get our answer.
Knowing how to calculate the probability, what will our answer be?
